messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help with 2 yr old, what dogs eat, what	we believe
messages.msgSnippet: well, I m not going through all of what my dog ate, and I don t think I want to find out what all your dogs ate, but it can be pretty yucky!  But that s what
messages.messageBody:
well,

I'm not going through all of what my dog ate, and I don't think I want to find out what all your dogs ate, but it can be pretty yucky! But that's what dogs do for their young'uns...

Weird story..don't know if I should share...but when my dog was a pup, almost ten years ago, he was playing with my son and jumped on his back...unfortunately he banged my son's head smack into the corner of the woodwork and we had to go have his head stitched...blood on the floor and I didn't have time to clean it up, but fully expected the dog to while we were gone.

Well, get home and the floor is still a mess, but once the dog saw our son, he cleaned it up! I really got the feeling that he was waiting to know that my child was okay!

Okay, I know that is anthropomorphism, but heck, it seems to fit.

be well,
Rachel Ann

----- Original Message -----
From: Fetteroll
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, September 29, 2002 6:21 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] help with 2 yr old, what dogs eat, what we believe


on 9/29/02 5:52 PM, Deborah Lewis at ddzimlew@... wrote:

> My dog ate cat barf once but that's probably not the same thing, huh?

Our dog loves that. Likes the stuff that comes out the other end of the cats
too.

Joyce
